Title.evidence: A recent randomized controlled trial (RCT), performed by the authors

Participants.evidence: chronic radiculopathy caused by lumbar disc herniation, defined as symptoms and/or signs of 4 to 12 months duration

Intervention.evidence: comparing early surgical microdiscectomy with 6 months of nonoperative care

Objective.evidence: is surgical management more cost-effective than 6 months of nonoperative care from the third-party payer perspective

Method_Outcome.evidence: QALYs derived from the EuroQoL-5D were the health outcome and were derived exclusively from the RCT data

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients in the early surgical treatment group had higher expected costs (CAD 4118 [95% CI 3429 to 4867]) than those with nonsurgical treatment (CAD 2377 [95% CI 1622 to 3518]), but they had better expected health outcomes (1.48 QALYs [95% CI 1.39 to 1.57] versus 1.30 [95% CI 1.22 to 1.37]).
